KnowledgeBase.Title: Example List comparison 020
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: compare compareEQ compareEQ compareGT compareNE compareLT compareLE

Example.Description: These examples use the compare functions to do a case-sensitive comparison of two objects of the same type. A Boolean value is returned.

Syntax.Expression: <sc> (&#62 '(a b c d e) '(a (b c) (d e) g )) </sc>
Syntax.Note: The first Quoted List is greater than the second List.
The first List is lesser than the second Pair.
Syntax.Hints: If you prefer an integer resulting from the comparison (0 for equal, -1 for less than, and 1 for greater than), use the compare function.
